page.title: 08SW BASINGSTOKE: RELIGION
page.content: Ther are five main places of worship: two {Baptist}Churches - These are used for worship and as meeting places for various clubs and groups. {Christ the King, Brighton Hill}- This is an inter-denominational church and is used by both {Roman catholic }and { {Church of England }worshippers. The hall is also used by the Brownies and a playgroup. {St.Leonard's,Cliddesden}- This church is C of E and its bell can be heard clearly from the Brighton Hill estate. {St. Andrew's, Farleigh Wallop}- Once a church used by the monks (and still connected with the manor by a tunnel) but now caters for C of E worshippers. {Jehovah's Witness}followers are also active on Brighton Hill and hold meetings in their homes. Larger meetings are held at Cranbourne School.
